abstract.text: A query that specifies a set of media items from the device’s media library using a filter and a grouping type.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Filter and grouping types are both optional; an unqualified query matches the entire library.
A query has at most one grouping type. A query’s filter can consist of any number of media property predicates. You build filters using
objects, based on property keys described in
After creating and configuring a query, you use it to retrieve media items or media item collections. You can also use a query to retrieve an array of
instances, useful for displaying the results of a query in the user interface of your app. See the
and
properties.

This class includes several convenience constructors that each apply a grouping type and, in most cases, match a subset of the library. The following table summarizes the features of these constructors. See
for descriptions of the entries in the Filter column. See
for descriptions of the entries in the Grouping type column.
Constructor name
Matches entire library
Filter
Grouping type

abstract.text: Find and play songs, audio podcasts, audio books, and more from within your app.
Keys used to configure a media query.
Groups and sorts media item collections by album, and sorts songs within an album by track order.
Groups and sorts media item collections by performing artist.
Groups and sorts media item collections by composer.
Groups and sorts media item collections by musical or film genre.
Groups and sorts media item collections by playlist.
Groups and sorts media item collections by podcast title.
Groups and sorts media item collections by title. For songs, for example, the title is the song name. This is the default grouping key.
A collection of properties that represents a single item in the media library.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the media item is part of a compilation.
An abstract class that defines classes for filtering media in a media query.
A set of predicates for defining a filter in a media query.
A query that specifies a set of media items from the device’s media library using a filter and a grouping type.
Initializes a generic media query.
Adds a media property predicate to a query.
Creates a media query that matches music items and that groups and sorts collections by album name.
Creates a media query that matches music items and that groups and sorts collections by artist name.
Creates a media query that matches audio book items and that groups and sorts collections by audio book name.
An array representing the section grouping of the query’s specified media item collections.
An array of media item collections whose contained items match the query’s media property predicate.
Creates a media query that matches compilation items and that groups and sorts collections by album name.
Creates a media query that matches all media items and that groups and sorts collections by composer name.
The media property predicates of the media query.
Creates a media query that matches all media items and that groups and sorts collections by genre name.
The grouping for collections retrieved with the media query.
Initializes a media query with a set of media property predicates.
An array representing the section grouping of the query’s specified media items.
An array of media items that match the media query’s predicate.
Creates a media query that matches the entire library and that groups and sorts collections by playlist name.
Creates a media query that matches podcast items and that groups and sorts collections by podcast name.
Removes a filter predicate from a query.
Creates a media query that matches music items and that groups and sorts collections by song name.
A range of media items or media item collections from within a media query.
The media item contains an unspecified type of media content.
The media item contains an audio book.
The media item contains music.
The media item contains a podcast.
Create a media player inside your app to play audio from the user’s media library.

doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentatio.title: Playing audio using the built-in music player

abstract.text: Add a filter set to a query before populating a music player queue.

doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentatio.title: Using filters to create specialized queries

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
The class methods in this section create queries which you can use directly or modify as described in Configuring media queries.

inlineContent.text: For each class method, the system sets the query’s
property automatically according to the name of the method. For example, the
method assigns a grouping type of

. The grouping type specifies the nature of the media item collections you can then retrieve from the query. Some class methods match the entire Music library while others match a subset, as described in the Discussion sections for each method.
